paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the most frequent subtype, short QT syndrome type 1 (SQT1), gain-of-function mutations in KCNH2/HERG (N588K) lead to an increased rapid delayed-rectifier K+ current (IKr) and a consecutive shortening of action potential (AP) duration (APD) and QT-duration.

functional_data.summary: The N588K variant leads to an increased rapid delayed-rectifier K+ current (IKr), resulting in shortened action potential duration and QT-duration.
assays: Cellular ventricular APs and ion currents

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with the disease phenotype in the SQT1 rabbit model.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a high risk of ventricular arrhythmias and sudden cardiac death.
key_quotes: In the most frequent subtype, short QT syndrome type 1 (SQT1), gain-of-function mutations in KCNH2/HERG (N588K) lead to an increased rapid delayed-rectifier K+ current (IKr) and a consecutive shortening of action potential (AP) duration (APD) and QT-duration.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly mentioned in the text.
